benchmark_details.name: GRAIL QA (Strongly Generalizable Question Answering)
benchmark_details.overview: The paper introduces GRAIL QA, a large-scale, high-quality dataset with 64,331 questions that supports evaluation of i.i.d., compositional, and zero-shot generalization in knowledge base question answering (KBQA).

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To facilitate the development of KBQA models with stronger generalization through a comprehensive dataset that evaluates three levels of generalization.

data.source: Crowdsourced questions based on the FREEBASE knowledge base and logical forms generated from it.
data.annotation: Crowdsourced via Amazon Mechanical Turk with various quality control mechanisms.

methodology.calculation: Exact match is determined by comparing predicted and gold logical forms based on graph isomorphism.
methodology.interpretation: Higher F1 scores and EM indicate better generalization performance of KBQA models across different question types.
methodology.baseline_results: RANKING model achieves competitive performance on GRAIL QA and sets new state-of-the-art on GRAPH Q.
methodology.validation: The dataset is split into training/validation/test sets with specific questions designated for i.i.d., compositional, and zero-shot evaluation.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Analysis of crowd worker demographics for quality and diversity in question generation.
